content: catbird studios 2 watermelon purse seeds row 15 join pink or red fancy fur with slip_stitch in any half_double_crochet chain 2 beg half_double_crochet half_double_crochet in each half_double_crochet around join with slip_stitch in second chain of beg half_double_crochet fasten_off top row 16 join pink or red ww yarn with single_crochet in any half_double_crochet single_crochet in each half_double_crochet around row 17 chain 2 beg half_double_crochet half_double_crochet in each single_crochet around join with sl in sec chain of beg half_double_crochet row 18 tie row chain 3 beg double_crochet double_crochet in next half_double_crochet chain 1 *double_crochet in next 2 half_double_crochet chain 1* repeat from * to * around fasten_off note if you find that you have an extra or one too few half_double_crochet when ending this row adjust the last set of double_crochet by putting 2 double_crochet in one half_double_crochet or skip two half_double_crochet instead of one at the end tie measure the circumference of the top of the purse with green ww yarn make a chain the length measured plus 12 fasten_off loop the chain through the top row of the purse leaving about 3 of the end of the chain at the beginning halfway around leave a 6 loop hanging out and continue threading the chain through at the end knot the ends together to close the purse hold both loops in one hand wrap other hand around the loops and pull down note to make a stronger tie make the chain with two strands of yarn use the purse as is or add a simple lining © 2005 catbird studios 3 watermelon purse other fruit suggestions strawberry use lion brand fancy fur firecracker red for the body & seeds section with red ww for the base and top and green for the tie red apple use a solid
